title: Purpose and objectives
body_md:
This policy sets out how {{firm.name}} implements the Senior Managers and Certification Regime (SMCR) to strengthen accountability, conduct, and governance.

Objectives:
- define roles within the SMCR population.
- maintain Statements of Responsibilities (SoRs) and evidence of reasonable steps.
- assess certification staff annually as fit and proper.
- embed COCON conduct rules across the firm.

title: Scope and applicability
body_md: This policy applies to Senior Managers (SMFs), Certification Staff, and Conduct Rules staff. It covers all areas where regulated activities are performed and extends to relevant contractors and appointed representatives where required.

title: SMCR roles and scope
body_md:
Roles are grouped into three populations:
- Senior Managers (SMFs) with FCA approval and defined responsibilities.
- Certification Staff assessed annually by the firm for fitness and propriety.
- Conduct Rules staff who must comply with COCON.

Role allocation must follow the firm role catalogue and responsibility map.

title: Statements of Responsibilities and reasonable steps
body_md:
Each Senior Manager must have a clear, up-to-date Statement of Responsibilities (SoR).

Reasonable steps include effective governance, appropriate delegation with oversight, documented challenge and decisions, and timely escalation of issues. Evidence should include MI packs, action logs, and handover records.

title: Duty of Responsibility
body_md:
A Senior Manager may be held accountable if a breach occurs in their area and they did not take reasonable steps to prevent or stop it.

Reasonable steps must be proportionate, documented, and timely.

title: Certification regime
body_md:
Certification Staff must be assessed annually as fit and proper based on honesty and integrity, competence and capability, and financial soundness.

Evidence includes training and competence logs, QA outcomes, role profiles, and regulatory references.

title: COCON conduct rules
body_md:
COCON applies to all Conduct Rules staff (Tier 1) with additional rules for Senior Managers (Tier 2).

Tier 1 includes acting with integrity, due skill and care, treating customers fairly, and cooperating with regulators. Tier 2 includes ensuring effective control of the business, oversight, and appropriate disclosure to regulators.

title: Non-financial misconduct
body_md:
Serious, substantiated non-financial misconduct (such as bullying or harassment) can affect fitness and propriety.

Cases must be assessed with HR and Compliance, and may trigger certification decisions and notifications as required.

title: Regulatory references
body_md:
Regulatory references are required for certain roles, including Senior Managers and Certification Staff.

References and responses must be retained and used in fit and proper decisions.

title: Records and evidence
body_md:
Records must include SoRs, responsibility maps, fit and proper assessments, conduct rule training records, disciplinary outcomes, and notification decisions.

Records must be retained in line with regulatory requirements.

title: Training and awareness
body_md: All staff must receive conduct rules training relevant to their role. Senior Managers and Certification Staff must complete enhanced training, with completion recorded and refreshed as required.

title: Governance and review
body_md: Compliance and HR oversee SMCR governance. Senior management reviews SMCR MI, breach reporting, and training completion on a defined cadence.
